content: Is it true that a large portion of Germany's budget is spent on foreign aid?

Yes, Germany is known for its significant contributions to foreign aid. According to data from the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), Germany is one of the largest donors of development assistance in the world. In recent years, Germany has been allocating around 0.7% of its gross national income (GNI) to official development assistance (ODA). This places it among the top contributors in terms of both absolute amounts and as a percentage of GNI. The country's commitment to foreign aid is part of its broader international policy aimed at promoting global development, reducing poverty, and addressing humanitarian crises.
